parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (13240004).  This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking campaign spending and are mandated for political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Demeter András István," who is a candidate for the UDMR party.  The hashtags #echipaudmrilfov and #UDMR explicitly link the post to a specific parliamentary candidate and party. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, targeting a wide audience (reach estimate >1M). The use of hashtags further suggests an attempt to reach a broad audience, not just personal communication. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The hashtags  #echipapentruilfovdeputați, #AlegeVoceaRațiunii, #echipapentruilfovsenat, and #GyőzőnAJózanÉsz clearly aim to influence voters to support Demeter András István and the UDMR in the Ilfov County elections. The phrase "Cetățeanul nu este poștaș, curier sau copiator de acte" ("The citizen is not a postman, courier, or document copier") while seemingly innocuous, can be interpreted as a subtle dig at opponents, implying they are engaging in less-than-honorable practices.  This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content is not journalistic in nature. It lacks objective reporting or analysis. Instead, it promotes a candidate and party, using slogans and implicit criticism of opponents.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The statement "Cetățeanul nu este poștaș, curier sau copiator de acte" could be considered a personal opinion, but within the context of a paid political advertisement promoting a candidate, it serves as a veiled attack on opponents and thus contributes to the overall electoral propaganda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>865550199077924</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Demeter András István), is clearly intended for a wide audience (paid Facebook post with high reach), has a clear electoral objective (promoting the candidate and party), and is not journalistic in nature. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its status as political advertising.  The post's timing is also crucial; even if the official campaign period has ended, the post's dissemination after the legal deadline is a violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Demeter András István</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ/UDMR, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 865550199077924) cu conținut electoral,  care promovează candidatul Demeter András István și partidul UDMR, folosind hashtag-uri precum #echipaudmrilfov și #UDMR,  și mesaje subliminale ca „Cetățeanul nu este poștaș, curier sau copiator de acte”,  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat. Postarea, care a avut o estimare a audienței de peste 1 milion de persoane și a costat între 100 și 199 RON,  constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie, conform articolului 98 t).  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt demeterandras@rmdsz.ro și +40745600964.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
